page.title: 09SHEERNESS: LOCAL NEWS 1
page.content: IN JULY 1985 THERE ARE 2 IMPORTANT TOPICS OF LOCAL NEWS. THE CLOSING OF THE{MATERNITY-UNIT}AND THE ROADWORKS ON{THE A249.}THE TIMES GUARDIAN IS SUPPORTING THE M.U.M.S.(MATERNITY-UNIT MUST STAY)CAMPAIGN. THE MATERNITY-UNIT IS THREATENED WITH CLOSURE BECAUSE OF THE GOVERNMENT CUTS IN PUBLIC SPENDING. IT IS NOT CONSIDERED ECONOMICAL TO KEEP A SMALL UNIT OPEN WHEN ANY PROBLEMS HAVE TO BE SENT TO MEDWAY HOSPITAL ANYWAY. MOST PEOPLE IN SHEPPEY FEEL THE MATERNITY-UNIT SHOULD STAY OPEN BECAUSE MANY PEOPLE DO NOT OWN A CAR. MANY WOMEN WOULD FIND TRAVELLING TO MEDWAY BY BUS AND TRAIN DIFFICULT AND THEY MAY NOT GO. IT MAY ALSO BE DANGEROUS IF THERE WAS AN EMERGENCY AND THE KINGS-FERRY BRIDGE WAS UP.
